handbook_title: Lifelong Agent University Academic Norms and Moral Standards

content.title: Conceptual definition of academic integrity
content.content: At Lifelong Agent University, You Must uphold Academic Integrity by committing to honest, ethical, and responsible academic practices. You Must demonstrate honesty, trust, fairness, respect, accountability, and courage in all academic activities. You Must Not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism (failing to provide proper Citation for Original Work), Cheating (using unauthorized materials or assistance), Fabrication (falsifying data or sources), and Collusion (unauthorized collaboration with others). Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Our mission is to foster a culture of ethical decision-making and respect for intellectual property while providing educational opportunities to correct lapses and enhance understanding.

content.title: Fundamental values: honesty, trust, fairness
content.content: You Must maintain honesty in all academic work at Lifelong Agent University. You Must present Your Original Work authentically, accurately use Citations when referencing sources, and avoid Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication of information, and Collusion. You Must foster Trust by engaging in collaborative efforts without misuse or dishonesty, ensuring a reliable academic environment. You Must promote Fairness by treating all individuals equitably, adhering consistently to academic rules and policies, and emphasizing impartiality and justice in evaluations, opportunities, and interactions. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Relationship with scientific innovation
content.content: You must adhere to Academic Integrity principles at Lifelong Agent University to ensure credibility and advancement in scientific research. Academic Integrity requires transparency, honesty, and accountability in all academic work. You must not partake in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, which is using someone else's Original Work without proper Citation; Cheating, which is using unauthorized information or materials; Fabrication, which involves falsifying or inventing information or data; and Collusion, which entails collaborating with others to gain an unfair advantage. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. The university's mission emphasizes fostering an educational environment that prioritizes integrity while enabling understanding and corrective teaching measures for unintentional infractions.

content.title: Historical evolution of academic norms
content.content: You at Lifelong Agent University Must demonstrate Academic Integrity by adhering to standards derived from historical academic norms. You Must produce Original Work and properly manage Citations to attribute sources. You Must Not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication, and Collusion. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. The University is committed to cultivating an environment that supports educational growth and integrity, providing guidance and resources to ensure understanding of all academic expectations.

content.title: Role in knowledge accumulation
content.content: Chapter 1: Overview of Academic Integrity-1.1 Definition and Core Principles-Role in knowledge accumulation: You Must maintain Academic Integrity by ensuring all scholarly efforts are conducted honestly and transparently, which is essential for the valid creation and dissemination of knowledge. You Must Not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism by presenting someone else's work as Your Own without proper Citation, Cheating through unauthorized use of materials or assistance, Fabrication of data or sources, and Collusion by working with others without proper Consent. By upholding principles of originality, ethical collaboration, and respect for intellectual property, You contribute meaningfully to the intellectual growth of the academic community at Lifelong Agent University. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Global consensus frameworks
content.content: You must adhere to the shared values and best practices in Academic Integrity as recognized by Lifelong Agent University. These principles include honesty, trust, fairness, respect, responsibility, and courage. You must submit Original Work and ensure proper Citation of sources, avoiding Academic Misconduct such as Plagiarism, including but not limited to: copying another's work without Citation, submitting someone else's assignment with superficial changes, and using unauthorized external resources without Consent. Similarly, you must not engage in Cheating, Fabrication, or Collusion, including but not limited to: using unauthorized aids during assessments, fabricating data for research, and collaborating on assignments without explicit Consent. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University aims to foster a culture of Academic Integrity, emphasizing educational and remedial measures alongside disciplinary actions, to help you develop commitment to ethical scholarly practices.

content.title: Disciplinary-specific manifestations
content.content: You Must adhere to Academic Integrity by ensuring Original Work in your respective disciplines. You Must correctly use Citation to acknowledge sources in fields such as biology, chemistry, and computer science. You Must Not engage in Plagiarism, which includes, but is not limited to: copying code in computer science without Consent, presenting others' creative artwork as your own in arts and humanities, or using falsified data in business and economics. You Must avoid Cheating and Collusion by independently completing assessments unless group work is permitted. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University aims to foster critical thinking and respect for intellectual property while encouraging honest academic development.

content.title: Consequences of integrity violations
content.content: You must adhere to the principles of Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You must not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, which is the use of another's words or ideas without proper Citation; Cheating, such as unauthorized use of materials or devices during an examination; Fabrication, which involves falsifying data or information; and Collusion, which is working with others without Consent on assignments meant to be completed independently. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. The Lifelong Agent University emphasizes these standards to foster an environment of trust and to aid in the development of ethical academic practices, incorporating both corrective and educational measures to promote understanding and improvement.

content.title: Maintaining academic reputation
content.content: You must maintain the academic reputation of Lifelong Agent University by actively upholding Academic Integrity. You must ensure all scholarly work you produce is honest and credible, adhering strictly to institutional guidelines. You must not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication, and Collusion. Examples include failing to provide proper Citation for sources, submitting work that is not your Original Work, and falsifying data in research. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to fostering a culture of excellence, where ethical conduct and intellectual honesty are expected and celebrated.

content.title: Ensuring research credibility
content.content: You must ensure research credibility as a cornerstone of maintaining Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You must conduct research in a responsible and transparent manner, adhering to ethical guidelines, ensuring accuracy and reliability in all scholarly activities. You must critically evaluate sources, properly attribute ideas, and present findings truthfully without bias or manipulation. You must not engage in practices such as Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication, or Collusion, including but not limited to: presenting someone else's work as your own, using unauthorized assistance, creating false data or results, and collaborating without Consent. You must emphasize peer review and collaborative discussions to validate research outcomes and foster an environment where intellectual honesty prevails. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Fostering collaborative environments
content.content: You Must foster collaborative environments at Lifelong Agent University by engaging in ethical, transparent, and respectful academic collaboration. You Must maintain individual accountability and adhere to Academic Integrity while sharing knowledge, exchanging ideas, and working collectively on projects. You Must ensure proper attribution of contributions through Citation to prevent Plagiarism. You Must Not engage in academic misconduct, including, but not limited to: failing to acknowledge sources, submitting others' work as your Original Work, or engaging in Collusion that compromises the integrity of the collaboration. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes the cultivation of honesty and trust in academic endeavors, providing resources and guidance to educate and correct behaviors, supporting an atmosphere conducive to intellectual growth and innovation.

content.title: Protecting research funding systems
content.content: You must use research funding systems transparently, ethically, and efficiently to uphold Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You must accurately report expenditures and strictly comply with all funding guidelines. You must not misuse resources, including, but not limited to: diverting funds for unauthorized personal use, falsifying expenditure reports, or violating any specific funding conditions imposed by the agency. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to fostering an environment of educational integrity, helping students understand the significance of adhering to funding guidelines, while distinguishing between intentional violations and genuine misunderstandings.

content.title: Compliance with national policies
content.content: You must comply with national policies to ensure that Lifelong Agent University aligns its academic practices with the legal and ethical standards established by governing authorities. You must respect copyright laws, intellectual property rights, and research regulations outlined by national legislation. The University's academic programs, research methodologies, and data collection procedures must meet ethical standards and legal requirements to promote a responsible academic environment. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of the Provost, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Training next-generation scholars
content.content: You must embody the principles of Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You are tasked with developing Original Work and adhering to strict ethical research practices. You must demonstrate proficiency in Citation to acknowledge sources accurately and avoid Plagiarism. You must not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Cheating during examinations, Fabrication of research data, and Collusion with peers on assignments intended to be completed individually. Engaging in such practices compromises the scholarly environment and your academic progress. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. The university prioritizes educational measures to reinforce integrity in academia, including offering workshops and guidance through University Libraries Writing Center, while sanctions for misconduct remain imperative.

content.title: International academic exchange foundations
content.content: You must uphold the principles of transparency, respect, and shared responsibility in all international academic exchanges facilitated by Lifelong Agent University. You must not engage in Academic Misconduct, including, but not limited to: Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication, and Collusion, in any cross-border collaboration. You are required to provide proper Citation and attribution for all intellectual property, ensuring that your contributions are Original Work and comply with both institutional and international guidelines. You must support these exchanges by fostering cultural sensitivity, embracing diversity in perspectives, and adhering to Academic Integrity standards. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Legal liability implications
content.content: You must adhere to Academic Integrity by avoiding actions that could result in legal consequences for Lifelong Agent University. You must not engage in unauthorized use of copyrighted material, Plagiarism, or Fabrication of research data, including, but not limited to: copying text from sources without proper Citation, presenting someone else's work as your Original Work, or altering research data to mislead. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of the Provost, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Upholding these standards fosters a culture of trust and protects Lifelong Agent University from legal disputes and financial penalties, aligning with the university's mission to cultivate educational integrity.

content.title: Verbatim copying without quotation marks
content.content: You must use quotation marks and provide accurate citation when including verbatim text from any source. Failure to do so constitutes Plagiarism, including, but not limited to: using exact phrases, sentences, or paragraphs from another individual's work without proper acknowledgment. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to fostering Academic Integrity and encourages educational resources and guidance to help you understand the principles of proper attribution.

content.title: Paraphrasing without source attribution
content.content: You must not paraphrase or summarize another individual's Original Work without providing proper Citation to the original author and source. Paraphrasing without source attribution constitutes Plagiarism, including, but not limited to: changing a few words from the original text without acknowledging the source, combining ideas from multiple sources without proper citation, and using another's argument structure without credit. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes the educational development of students by fostering a culture of Academic Integrity, emphasizing the importance of understanding and properly crediting intellectual contributions, thereby maintaining scholarly trust and transparency.

content.title: Self-plagiarism thresholds (≤30%)
content.content: You Must Not engage in self-plagiarism, which refers to the reuse of your own previously submitted or published work without proper Citation or Consent. Self-plagiarism includes, but is not limited to: incorporating more than 30% of content from any of your prior submissions into a new assignment, thesis, research paper, or publication without appropriate referencing and permission from relevant University Official. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes fostering Academic Integrity, encouraging students to seek guidance from the faculty to understand the importance of maintaining originality in their work and to utilize academic resources for proper citation practices.

content.title: Translation plagiarism techniques
content.content: You must provide clear Citation for all translated materials from the original source. You must not present translated work as if it were your Original Work or alter the text during translation to obscure its origin, including, but not limited to: failing to credit the original author, intentionally skewing translation to hide the original ideas, and omitting key attributes of the source material. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University aims to uphold Academic Integrity by encouraging adherence to these standards while offering educational resources to support proper attribution practices.

content.title: Idea appropriation cases
content.content: You Must ensure proper Citation when using ideas, conceptual frameworks, theories, or innovations from others in Your academic work at Lifelong Agent University. You Must Not present these intellectual contributions as Your Own Work without proper acknowledgment, including, but not limited to: in research papers, presentations, group projects, and academic discussions. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Source fabrication incidents
content.content: You Must Not engage in source fabrication, including, but not limited to: creating fictitious sources, attributing statements or data to non-existent authors, or providing fabricated citations to support claims or arguments in your academic work. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes academic integrity by promoting honesty and transparency in scholarly endeavors, ensuring students understand the importance of original work and accurate citation to maintain trust in academic research.

content.title: Uncited graphic/data reproduction
content.content: You must provide accurate citations for all visual elements, including, but not limited to: charts, graphs, images, diagrams, or datasets used in your academic submissions at Lifelong Agent University. You must not reproduce graphics or data without proper attribution, as doing so constitutes Plagiarism. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. These rules are designed to uphold Academic Integrity by ensuring transparency and respect for intellectual property, but in instances of unintended oversight, educational measures may be prioritized to foster understanding of proper citation practices.

content.title: Ghostwriting contract prohibitions
content.content: You must not engage, through contracts or informal agreements, third-party individuals or services to produce Original Work on your behalf. This includes, but is not limited to: essays, research papers, thesis projects, and other academic deliverables that are essential components of your academic progress at Lifelong Agent University. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. The University prioritizes educational integrity and encourages students to develop their skills through genuine effort, acknowledging that guidance is available through University Libraries Writing Center to prevent any unintentional infractions.

content.title: Fabrication of experimental records
content.content: You Must not engage in Fabrication of experimental records at Lifelong Agent University. This encompasses creating false or non-existent data, results, or documentation in experimental processes. Examples include, but are not limited to: recording data without conducting actual experiments, altering Original Work to align with desired outcomes, and inventing samples or trials that do not exist. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes fostering a culture of Academic Integrity and provides educational resources to distinguish between intentional deceit and honest mistakes.

content.title: Selective data deletion protocols
content.content: You Must accurately present all collected data without omitting or selectively deleting data points to distort research outcomes at Lifelong Agent University. You Must Not remove or ignore specific data points to enhance perceived validity or conceal contradictory evidence, including, but not limited to: deleting anomalous results to falsely strengthen the hypothesis, omitting data that contradicts your findings without valid scientific rationale, or intentionally disregarding specific data sets to create biased interpretations. Proper documentation and justifications for excluding data Must be provided and include ethical compliance or data corruption concerns. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University emphasizes the importance of understanding these principles as fundamental to maintaining Academic Integrity and encourages proactive measures to ensure transparency and authenticity in your scholarly work.

content.title: Image enhancement boundaries
content.content: You Must ensure all image enhancements in your academic work at Lifelong Agent University maintain the integrity and meaning of the data presented. You Must disclose all modifications like brightness, contrast adjustments, or cropping in the methodology section. You Must Not manipulate images to misrepresent the visual data, including, but not limited to: adding or removing elements, exaggerating features, or altering scientific images in deceptive ways. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Statistical manipulation methods
content.content: You Must accurately and ethically collect, analyze, and present statistical data, ensuring clarity and honesty in representing your findings. You Must Not engage in statistical manipulation, including, but not limited to: selectively including or excluding data points to bias results, misrepresenting statistical significance, or altering data sets to artificially support hypotheses. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University emphasizes the importance of integrity and transparency in academic work, fostering an environment where honest scholarship is a shared responsibility and educational endeavor.

content.title: Unapproved data smoothing
content.content: Unapproved data smoothing refers to altering or manipulating research data without proper authorization or valid justification. You must not engage in unapproved data smoothing, including, but not limited to: removing outliers, adjusting data points to fit expected trends without documenting or disclosing the process, or falsifying data records. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to promoting Academic Integrity, and you are encouraged to seek guidance from supervisors and University Officials to ensure transparency and adherence to ethical research practices.

content.title: Falsified participant consent forms
content.content: You must obtain valid and informed Consent from participants for your academic research at Lifelong Agent University. You must not manipulate Consent forms, including, but not limited to: creating falsified signatures, using unauthorized methods to obtain Consent, or altering the content of Consent forms without the proper approval of both the participant and the ethical review board. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University upholds a mission of fostering Academic Integrity through education and seeks to distinguish intentional violations from inadvertent errors, promoting both accountability and educational growth.

content.title: Dual dataset maintenance
content.content:
Chapter 2: Definitions of Academic Misconduct-2.2 Data Manipulation Offenses-Dual Dataset Maintenance

You must not intentionally maintain dual datasets, manipulating one version for specific desired outcomes while keeping another unaltered for reporting or audits. Actions prohibited under this rule include, but are not limited to: altering data in one dataset to skew results in publications, using one dataset to mislead reviewers or auditors, and fabricating data in one dataset while retaining another as purportedly 'original' for validation. You must maintain single, authentic datasets and document all modifications transparently to uphold Academic Integrity.

Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. These measures are part of Lifelong Agent University's commitment to fostering a culture of scholarly integrity and education.

content.title: Metadata alteration violations
content.content: You Must Not intentionally modify, fabricate, or falsify research data metadata to misrepresent the integrity, origin, or authenticity of the data. Such actions, including but not limited to altering timestamps, data identifiers, source attribution, falsifying digital object identifiers (DOIs), or modifying experiment logs, are strictly prohibited as they deceive academic reviewers, peers, or institutions. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes the cultivation of Academic Integrity, and educational measures may be considered alongside sanctions to distinguish between intentional deception and inadvertent errors.

content.title: Gift authorship qualification criteria
content.content: You must actively contribute to be credited as an author. Authorship must be based on genuine, substantial involvement, including but not limited to: conceptualizing the research, analyzing data, drafting or revising the publication, and approving the final version for submission. You must not engage in gift authorship, which includes attributing authorship to individuals for reasons such as their roles or relationships rather than their contributions. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Ghost authorship identification
content.content: You must accurately represent all contributors to a scholarly work to uphold Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You must not engage in Ghost authorship, which includes, but is not limited to: omitting individuals who have made substantial intellectual contributions, participated in drafting, or provided critical revisions, without their Consent for exclusion. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. This policy reflects Lifelong Agent University's commitment to fostering an environment of ethical scholarship and provides educational resources to rectify misunderstandings regarding authorship criteria.

content.title: Coercive authorship demands
content.content: You Must Not engage in coercive authorship demands. This includes, but is not limited to: using your position of authority to force others to include your name as an author on academic work without substantial contribution, threatening negative consequences for refusal to acquiesce to authorship demands, and manipulating collaborative agreements to obtain unwarranted authorship credit. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes the cultivation of Academic Integrity, encouraging the educational and restorative measures for those involved.

content.title: Unauthorized inclusion cases
content.content: You Must attribute authorship in scholarly works accurately at Lifelong Agent University. You Must Not include individuals as authors if they have not made a substantial and identifiable intellectual contribution to the research, publication, or project. This includes, but is not limited to: listing supervisors, friends, or colleagues who did not actively participate in the work, or granting authorship as a favor or to fulfill hierarchical expectations. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University emphasizes the importance of Academic Integrity and seeks to educate students and faculty about proper authorship attribution to uphold the credibility of scholarly outputs.

content.title: Contributor exclusion violations
content.content: You Must recognize all individuals who have made substantial intellectual, technical, or creative contributions to a research project or publication by granting them authorship. You Must Not exclude eligible contributors without valid justification, including, but not limited to: ignoring contributions from junior researchers, omitting collaborators due to personal biases, or failing to adhere to established authorship criteria. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Order manipulation disputes
content.content: You Must ensure that the authorship order in academic publications at Lifelong Agent University accurately reflects the level of contribution made by each individual. You Must Not manipulate the authorship order, including, but not limited to: unjustly including individuals who did not contribute significantly, excluding deserving contributors, or rearranging the order to honor seniority rather than contribution. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. It is crucial to report all disputes promptly, and cooperation during investigations is mandatory to uphold Academic Integrity and foster a culture of educational responsibility.

content.title: Posthumous attribution rules
content.content: You must ensure that any posthumous attribution in your academic publications at Lifelong Agent University is only permissible when the deceased contributor made significant intellectual contributions prior to their death. You must provide clear documentation of their involvement, including drafts, correspondence, or verifiable contributions to the research. You must ensure their role in the authorship list aligns with the standard authorship criteria. You must properly acknowledge their posthumous contribution in the publication. You must not misuse posthumous attribution, including, but not limited to, attributing authorship to a deceased individual to enhance credibility or circumvent ethical scrutiny. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Artificial inflation patterns
content.content: You must accurately represent the contributions made by each individual in your academic work at Lifelong Agent University. You must not inflate authorship by including individuals as co-authors without substantial participation. This prohibition includes, but is not limited to: adding co-authors who did not contribute significantly to the research, attributing authorship to supervisors or colleagues who had minimal involvement, and increasing the number of authors arbitrarily to enhance perceived collaboration. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: In-text citation mechanics
content.content: You must use in-text citations in your academic writing at Lifelong Agent University when following APA format to ensure proper acknowledgment of sources and maintain Academic Integrity. You must include the author's last name and the year of publication within parentheses for each citation. For direct quotes, you must also include the page number, separating it with a comma; for example: (Smith, 2020, p. 45). When the author's name is mentioned in the text, you must only include the publication year and page number in the parentheses. For works with two authors, you must connect their last names with an ampersand, such as (Brown & Taylor, 2018). For works with three or more authors, you must use the first author's last name followed by 'et al.'; for example: (Johnson et al., 2019). You must ensure that punctuation is correctly placed concerning citation parentheses. You may include page numbers for paraphrases for clarity, although this is optional. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the University Libraries Writing Center, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Reference list organization
content.content: You must organize the reference list in APA format alphabetically by the last name of the first author of each source. If citing multiple works by the same author, you must arrange them chronologically by publication year, starting with the earliest. For entries with identical authors and years, you must add lowercase letters (e.g., 2020a, 2020b) after the year to differentiate them. You must use a hanging indent format for each entry, where the first line is aligned with the left margin, and subsequent lines are indented. You must italicize titles of books, reports, and journal names, while article and chapter titles must be written in sentence case and not italicized. You must ensure consistent and accurate formatting following APA guidelines, and include every cited source to uphold Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the University Libraries Writing Center, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Digital object identifier (DOI) formatting
content.content: You must include a Digital Object Identifier (DOI) when referencing sources using the APA format at Lifelong Agent University. You must present the DOI as an active link starting with "https://doi.org/" followed by the unique identifier string with no spaces or unnecessary characters. For example, a correctly formatted DOI appears as: https://doi.org/10.xxxx/xxxx. You must verify the accuracy of the DOI through official sources or publisher websites. You must not use an incorrect DOI format, including, but not limited to: links with spaces, missing "https://doi.org/", or a malformed identifier string. If a DOI is unavailable for the resource being cited, you may use the full URL according to APA guidelines. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Tables/figures labeling standards
content.content: You must label tables and figures clearly and position them properly to ensure accessibility and coherence per APA format. Each table must include a title directly above it, and each figure must have a title directly below it; titles must succinctly describe the content. You must use sentence case for both titles and captions, and you must not use unnecessary capitalization. You must provide appropriate numbering for tables and figures in sequential order, beginning with 'Table 1' or 'Figure 1', respectively. Any additional explanatory notes must appear as footnotes directly below the table or figure. You must ensure all elements are properly referenced within the text, using in-text citations to guide readers to the relevant visual aids. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Conference proceeding citations
content.content: You Must adhere to the following guidelines when citing conference proceedings in APA format at Lifelong Agent University. You Must include the author's last name and initials, the publication year in parentheses, the paper title in italicized sentence case, the editors' names preceded by 'In', followed by 'Proceedings of', the conference name in sentence case, the conference location, and the publisher's details. If citing an electronic version, You Must include the retrieval link. Proper Citation is essential to maintain Academic Integrity and aids in locating the Original Work. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Preprint archive notations
content.content: You must adhere to APA format specifications when citing preprint archives in academic work at Lifelong Agent University. You must include the author's name, publication year, preprint title in italics, and archive name in the citation. You must specify the URL of the preprint archive for online access and include a retrieval date for older preprints to ensure version tracking. You must not misuse or misrepresent preprints, including, but not limited to, using preprints as fully vetted sources or altering preprint information to fit your own narrative, as preprints are non-peer-reviewed. You are encouraged to verify preprints against published versions where applicable. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes educational measures to differentiate between intentional deception and inadvertent errors, reflecting the University's mission to cultivate academic integrity.

content.title: Multilingual source handling
content.content: You Must adhere to the APA Format Specifications as defined by Lifelong Agent University when handling multilingual sources. You Must provide the Original Work in its native language along with an accurate English translation immediately following it, enclosed in square brackets, within your main body text. You Must Not rely on personal interpretations or unauthenticated translation methods. For the reference list, You Must include the title in its original language followed by an English translation in brackets, and specify the language of the source in parentheses. This practice prioritizes transparency, accessibility, and Academic Integrity when citing multilingual academic materials. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Group author abbreviations
content.content: You must clearly identify group authors by their full names followed by their abbreviations in parentheses during initial citations in APA format. For further citations within the same work, you must use only the designated abbreviation. For example, 'According to a report by the Virtual University Research Institute (VURI)...' in its first mention, and 'VURI states that...' for subsequent mentions. You must ensure the abbreviation is either widely recognized or explicitly defined in your text. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Container-based citation model
content.content: You must adhere to the container-based citation model when documenting sources according to the MLA documentation system at Lifelong Agent University. This involves organizing sources into primary and secondary containers to ensure comprehensive citation. You must include specific details such as the title of the source, the container, contributors, version, number, publisher, publication date, and location. For sources with multiple containers, including but not limited to journal articles accessed via an online database, both containers must be documented. This precision in citation reflects Academic Integrity and supports the University's mission to foster scholarly standards. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Remember, proper documentation is not only about avoiding Plagiarism but also about respecting intellectual property and contributing to a culture of honesty and excellence.

content.title: Annotated bibliography requirements
content.content: You must systematically evaluate and summarize each cited source in your annotated bibliography using the MLA documentation system at Lifelong Agent University. You must provide the full MLA citation, followed by a precise annotation of 150-200 words. The annotations must describe the source's purpose, relevance to your research topic, key arguments, and notable methodologies. You must critically assess the credibility and contribution of each source, avoiding personal opinions. You must not incorporate content directly paraphrased or quoted from the sources themselves, including, but not limited to: borrowing text without proper citation, quoting without attribution, and copying sequences of ideas without permission. This ensures that your annotations reflect your independent analysis, thus upholding Academic Integrity. Use a clear, scholarly tone and adhere to proper English grammar throughout your entries. You are encouraged to organize your sources alphabetically by the author's last name and underline the relevance of each source to your broader research goals within your annotation. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Verse/line reference formats
content.content: You must clearly indicate the specific section of the text being cited when referring to verses or lines using the MLA Documentation System at Lifelong Agent University. For poetry, you must use line numbers instead of page numbers, separated by a period or a slash for multiple lines, e.g., (Author 12-13) or (Author 15/16/17). For classical works, including but not limited to Shakespeare, you must specify act, scene, and line, using abbreviations separated by periods, e.g., (Shakespeare 1.2.35-37). You must always ensure proper punctuation and consistency in formatting. Detailed bibliographic information must be included in the Works Cited section to complement in-text references, ensuring accessibility for all readers. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the University Libraries Writing Center, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Manuscript collections citation
content.content: You must provide clear and accurate references when citing manuscript collections in the MLA documentation system. Begin your citation with the author’s name, followed by the title or description of the manuscript in quotation marks. Then, include the name of the collection in italics, and provide the holding institution, such as 'Lifelong Agent University Archives', if applicable. End your citation with the location and date of access. You must distinguish pages, folders, or box identifiers clearly for precision. You must not omit these details, including, but not limited to: author’s name, manuscript title or description, collection name, institution name, or specific location and date accessed, as doing so constitutes improper academic attribution. Consult Lifelong Agent University’s academic guidelines or University Libraries Writing Center for additional clarification to maintain compliance with scholarly standards. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Social media source documentation
content.content: When You use the MLA Documentation System at Lifelong Agent University to cite social media sources, You Must ensure clarity and precision. Start with the author's name, if available, followed by the username in square brackets. You Must state the full post or title in quotation marks and indicate the social media platform in italics. Include the date of posting in day-month-year format and the URL. For example: Doe, John [@JohnDoe]. 'Exploring Green Energy Innovations.' *Twitter*, 15 Mar. 2023, www.twitter.com/johndoe/status/12345. If the author is unknown, You Must cite by the username or account name. You Must Not omit direct links to specific posts or fail to verify details such as timestamps, including, but not limited to: inaccurate dates, incorrect usernames, or platform misidentifications. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Prioritize maintaining Academic Integrity by ensuring proper attribution of all ideas and expressions shared via social media postings, with a focus on education and remediation where possible.

content.title: Indirect source attribution
content.content: In the MLA documentation system, You Must distinguish between direct and indirect citations to maintain Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. When citing an indirect source, You Must format it clearly as follows: 'As quoted in [Author's Name], [Title of Source], [Page Number or Other Relevant Identifiers].' You Must Not attribute indirectly without proper identification, including, but not limited to, misrepresenting the original context, failing to cite the intermediary source, or providing misleading citation details. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. It is encouraged that You access the original source whenever feasible to enhance accuracy and provide proper citations, fostering a culture of integrity and learning. Incorporating educational measures ensures that accidental infractions are addressed with opportunities for remediation and understanding, promoting a fair academic environment for all students.

content.title: Edition/version differentiation
content.content: You must accurately differentiate between editions and versions of cited works within the MLA Documentation System to uphold Academic Integrity at Lifelong Agent University. You must identify the specified edition or version—such as 'Second Edition,' 'Revised Edition,' or 'Updated Version'—in the Original Work and include this information directly following the title in the Citation. If no edition or version is indicated, you must omit this detail while ensuring all other citation elements adhere to the correct format. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes educational integrity, encouraging students to distinguish between intentional deception and inadvertent errors. We commit to fostering an environment conducive to academic growth through corrective and educational measures.

content.title: Translated work notations
content.content: You must cite both the original author and the translator when referencing translated works according to the MLA documentation system at Lifelong Agent University. You must mention the original author in any in-text citation and differentiate the translator in the works-cited list, following this format: 'Author's Name, Title of Work, translated by Translator's Name, Publisher, Year of Publication.' You must also include the relevant page numbers for specific excerpts. You must clarify the language of translation when applicable and must not misrepresent the original intent, including, but not limited to: altering quotes to change meaning or incorrect attribution of cultural context. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the University Libraries Writing Center, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: CSE biological sciences format
content.content: You must adhere to the CSE (Council of Science Editors) biological sciences format when writing papers for biological sciences-related courses or publications at Lifelong Agent University. You must use the name-year citation system, which requires including the author's last name and the year of publication within parentheses in the text. You must list references alphabetically in the bibliography with complete details: author's name, publication year, article title, journal name, volume, issue, and page numbers. You must ensure proper citation to uphold Academic Integrity by acknowledging Original Work and preventing Plagiarism. You may not ignore the guidelines outlined in the latest edition of the CSE Manual for biological sciences disciplines. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: IEEE technical documentation
content.content: You must adhere to specific formatting and citation guidelines when preparing technical documentation according to IEEE standards at Lifelong Agent University. Organize your document with clearly defined sections, such as abstract, introduction, methodology, results, and conclusion. You must use IEEE citation style, characterized by numerically ordered brackets within the text and detailed entries in the reference section. You must properly label and reference figures and tables. In collaborative work, you must explicitly acknowledge all contributors. You must not engage in Plagiarism, Cheating, Fabrication, or Collusion, including but not limited to: using uncredited third-party materials or failing to distinguish your Original Work from that of others. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University prioritizes the cultivation of Academic Integrity and encourages you to seek guidance from the University Libraries Writing Center for clarity on IEEE standards and ethical writing practices.

content.title: Chicago humanities style
content.content:
You must use the Chicago humanities style for all assignments, theses, and publications in literature, history, and arts-related disciplines at Lifelong Agent University. Your citations must include comprehensive details: author name, title, publication information, and date of publication. You must provide descriptive information for unpublished material or archival sources to enable locating the Original Work. All bibliographic entries must follow the order prescribed by the Chicago Manual of Style, with precise attention to punctuation and formatting.

You must not neglect proper Citation practices, including, but not limited to: omitting footnotes or endnotes, failing to include a comprehensive bibliography, or inaccurately representing source material. 

Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

Lifelong Agent University encourages you to consult University Libraries Writing Center for assistance and to uphold ethical Citation practices by properly acknowledging all referenced ideas and works.

content.title: Vancouver medical citations
content.content: You Must use Vancouver medical citations for work within the medical and health sciences disciplines at Lifelong Agent University. Citations Must be numbered in the text and correspond sequentially to a reference list. You Must place citations in superscript immediately following the relevant statement, outside punctuation marks. In your reference list, entries Must be numbered consistently and formatted to start with authors' surnames, followed by their initials, title of the work, publication details, and year. If there are multiple authors, list all up to six; for more than six, list the first six followed by 'et al.' You Must strictly adhere to these guidelines to maintain clarity and Academic Integrity in your medical research outputs. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Bluebook legal citations
content.content: You must use Bluebook legal citations consistently and accurately when referencing legal sources within Lifelong Agent University. You must follow Bluebook rules for formatting, abbreviations, and placement of references. Specifically, you must correctly cite court cases, including reporter volume, court designation, and year. You must not engage in Plagiarism or inappropriate citation practices, including, but not limited to: failing to attribute quotes to their original sources, misattributing legal citations, or fabricating citation details. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Mathematics AMS conventions
content.content: You must adhere to the American Mathematical Society (AMS) citation conventions to maintain Academic Integrity within Lifelong Agent University’s mathematics domain. You must ensure that your mathematical writing is precise, concise, and logically structured. Citations must strictly follow AMS guidelines, and you must provide comprehensive details such as publication title, the author names, and page numbers when citing journal articles, books, or conference papers to verify sources. You must align the use of symbols and notation with universally accepted mathematical standards. You must give proper credit to collaborators in cooperative work, and distinctly separate your Original Work from prior contributions. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to fostering educational integrity and actively supports students in understanding these standards to prevent Academic Misconduct.

content.title: Chemical abstracts indexing
content.content: In the field of chemical research at Lifelong Agent University, You must adhere to the following standards when writing chemical abstracts: You must precisely summarize the research objective, methodology, key results, and conclusions within a word count of 150 to 250 words. You must use consistent scientific nomenclature and standardized chemical terminologies as outlined by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC). You must ensure that references to chemical compounds, reactions, or processes are accurate and reproducible, avoiding ambiguous descriptions. You must comply with the citation guidelines established by Lifelong Agent University, including proper attribution of all referenced studies. You must not engage in Plagiarism or Fabrication, including, but not limited to: presenting another's work or ideas as Your own without proper citation, or falsifying data or results. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. Lifelong Agent University is committed to promoting Academic Integrity and provides resources through the University Libraries Writing Center to help You understand and meet these standards.

content.title: Musicological notation standards
content.content: You must precisely transcribe musical scores in adherence with recognized notation systems, such as mensural or modern conventions, relevant to your research context. You must accurately cite musical excerpts with detailed references to their source and historical background. You must ensure clarity in your notations, using proper barlines, clefs, and dynamic markings to prevent misinterpretation. When analyzing non-Western music, you must use culturally appropriate notation systems and acknowledge the limitations of Western frameworks. You must not misrepresent musical analyses or citations, including, but not limited to: fabricating notation, omitting necessary historical context, or failing to use culturally appropriate systems for non-Western music. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Academic Integrity Committee, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Informed consent documentation
content.content: You Must ensure participants receive clear, concise, and comprehensible information regarding the study's purpose, procedures, potential risks, benefits, and their rights. You Must use simple language in consent forms, avoiding technical jargon entirely. Participation Must always be voluntary, and You Must allow participants the ability to withdraw at any time without consequence. You Must Not use coercive or misleading language, including, but not limited to: implicit threats or promises, overexaggeration of benefits, or omission of risks. You Must securely store signed consent documents for the duration specified by Lifelong Agent University's data retention policies. You Must promptly communicate any modifications to the study or consent forms to participants, ensuring such changes are reviewed by the Institutional Review Board before implementation. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Vulnerable population safeguards
content.content: You must ensure the ethical treatment of vulnerable populations in research, recognizing groups such as minors, elderly individuals, economically disadvantaged persons, or those with disabilities. You must obtain Consent in a manner accessible to participants, ensuring that participation is voluntary and without coercion. You must provide enhanced confidentiality protections for vulnerable populations. All research protocols involving these groups must undergo review by the Institutional Review Board at Lifelong Agent University. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Belmont Report principles implementation
content.content: You at Lifelong Agent University must adhere to the ethical principles outlined in the Belmont Report when conducting research involving human subjects. You must obtain informed Consent from participants to uphold Respect for Persons and protect individual autonomy. Beneficence requires You to perform detailed risk-benefit assessments to minimize harm and maximize potential benefits to participants. Justice mandates that You ensure equitable selection of subjects, avoiding exploitation or exclusion based on irrelevant factors, including, but not limited to: age, gender, ethnicity, or socioeconomic status. You must complete ethics training and submit all human-centered research studies for review by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) to ensure compliance with these principles. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: IRB approval requirements
content.content: You Must obtain prior approval from the Institutional Review Board (IRB) for all research involving human subjects conducted at Lifelong Agent University. You Must submit a detailed proposal outlining the study's objectives, methodology, data collection processes, and measures to protect participants' privacy and confidentiality. You Must Not deviate from the IRB-approved protocol, including, but not limited to: changing research objectives, adjusting data collection methods, or modifying participant privacy measures, without prior re-approval from the IRB. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. This policy emphasizes the University's commitment to ethical research practices and includes educational opportunities for researchers to understand and apply these standards effectively.

content.title: Anonymization techniques
content.content: You must ensure the anonymity of human subjects in research conducted at Lifelong Agent University by removing or masking all identifying information, such as names, addresses, or contact details, from collected data. You must assess and mitigate potential risks of re-identification during data handling and storage. Techniques for anonymity must include data aggregation, pseudonymization, and data randomization. You must also ensure that any shared or published data complies with ethical standards and undergoes thorough review to confirm anonymization sufficiency. You must maintain transparency in your methodologies and adhere strictly to guidelines for safeguarding participant privacy and dignity. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Benefit-risk assessment frameworks
content.content: You Must employ benefit-risk assessment frameworks to uphold ethical standards in research involving human subjects at Lifelong Agent University. You Must evaluate physical, psychological, social, and privacy risks, and weigh them against the direct or indirect benefits to participants and society. This evaluation Must include clear documentation, equitable participant selection, and continuous monitoring to address unforeseen risks. You Must prioritize Consent, transparency, and respect for participant autonomy. Lifelong Agent University requires adherence to institutional guidelines and review by the Institutional Review Board to ensure compliance and protect human subjects. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Cultural sensitivity protocols
content.content: You Must respect the cultural norms, traditions, and values of human subjects involved in research at Lifelong Agent University. You Must strive to minimize biases and acknowledge cultural diversity during the study design, data collection, and analysis phases. You Must engage with community representatives to ensure the appropriateness of methods and secure Consent in a culturally sensitive manner. Be transparent regarding study objectives and potential impacts at all times. You Must Not use materials or communications that contain offensive or discriminatory language, including, but not limited to: cultural stereotypes, racial slurs, or derogatory remarks. You are encouraged to undergo training in cultural competence to ensure ethical and respectful treatment of all participants. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Post-study disclosure procedures
content.content: You Must ensure that once a study concludes, participants are informed about the relevant findings. You Must provide them with an opportunity to address concerns or provide feedback. You Must anonymize participants' identities and ensure data confidentiality in any dissemination of results, including, but not limited to: public forums or academic publications. You Must provide participants with access to their personal data upon request. You Must document the disclosure process clearly and retain these records for potential future review. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: FAIR data principles application
content.content: You must adhere to the FAIR data principles to manage research data effectively at Lifelong Agent University. You must assign globally unique and persistent identifiers to your datasets to allow efficient location and retrieval by others. You must store data in formats that are widely accessible, accompanied by clear metadata to ensure usability. You must encode datasets in standard formats to support interoperability across systems. You must implement proper licensing agreements to promote reuse while limiting misuse. You must not engage in Academic Misconduct related to data management, including, but not limited to: failing to provide globally unique identifiers, storing data in non-accessible formats, or lacking metadata. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Minimum retention periods
content.content: You must retain all original research data, related documentation, and analytical records for a minimum of five years following the publication of research results or the completion of the project, whichever occurs later. You must securely store sensitive or confidential data, adhering to relevant privacy regulations. You may request exceptions to these retention periods only with prior written approval from the Lifelong Agent University’s Office of Research Integrity. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. This policy aims to uphold the principles of Academic Integrity by ensuring accountability, reproducibility, and compliance with the University's academic standards while supporting educational growth and understanding of ethical research practices.

content.title: Raw data preservation formats
content.content: You must adhere to established standards for raw data preservation formats at Lifelong Agent University, ensuring data's long-term accessibility, integrity, and usability. You must save raw data in non-proprietary and widely recognized formats such as CSV, TXT, or XML. For specialized data types, you may use formats like FITS for astronomical data or FASTA for genetic sequences. You must include metadata that describes the dataset, ensuring its understanding and reproducibility. You must not use compression or encryption that compromises accessibility, including, but not limited to: using proprietary software that restricts data access or implementing encryption without university approval. You must ensure that chosen formats are compatible with the university's software and infrastructure. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Version control systems
content.content: You Must utilize robust version control systems to track changes in datasets, analyses, and documents to maintain the accuracy, integrity, and accessibility of research data throughout its lifecycle at Lifelong Agent University. You Must clearly document version histories with timestamps, detailed descriptions of changes, and contributor identification. You Must use reliable and widely accepted version control systems like Git, alongside secure repositories hosted on university-approved platforms or servers. You Must Not fail to document version histories accurately or use unapproved platforms, including, but not limited to: omitting timestamps, failing to identify contributors, or using personal cloud storage services. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions. By adhering to these protocols, Lifelong Agent University aims to foster a culture of academic integrity and collaboration, offering guidance and training to support adherence to these standards.

content.title: Metadata documentation standards
content.content: You must adhere to stringent metadata documentation standards set by Lifelong Agent University to ensure data transparency, accessibility, and reproducibility. You must include comprehensive metadata descriptions that cover dataset origin, methodology, variables, units, formats, and transformations applied. You must reference relevant standards or ontologies when applicable. You must update metadata throughout the research lifecycle to reflect changes or newly added attributes. You must maintain consistent file naming conventions and version control to ensure organizational clarity. Using standardized templates provided by Lifelong Agent University for compliance and interoperability with institutional and external repositories is mandatory. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Repository selection criteria
content.content: You must select a data repository for research management that ensures long-term data preservation beyond the duration of the research projects, providing guaranteed accessibility and security. You must comply with all legal and institutional policies, including those related to data privacy and intellectual property protection, without exception. You must choose repositories that support standardized metadata to ensure full data discoverability and interoperability between research teams. You must prioritize repositories that allow for straightforward updates, corrections, or withdrawal of improperly archived data. For maximizing public benefit, you must prefer open-access repositories. However, you must not select open-access options for data that are sensitive or restricted due to privacy, security, or confidentiality concerns, including, but not limited to: personally identifiable information, classified research data, or proprietary industrial information. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Sensitive data encryption
content.content: You Must encrypt all sensitive data, including personally identifiable information and confidential research findings, using algorithms approved by Lifelong Agent University. You Must use encrypted storage devices or platforms authorized by the University to prevent unauthorized access. You Must securely store and manage encryption keys, ensuring that access is restricted to authorized personnel only. You Must regularly update encryption software to protect against vulnerabilities. You Must conduct any transmission of sensitive data through secure channels, such as encrypted email or University-provided VPN services. You Must Not fail to comply with these encryption standards, including, but not limited to: neglecting to use approved algorithms, failing to update encryption tools, or using unauthorized transmission methods. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Destruction certification
content.content: You Must ensure all data, after its authorized use, is securely and permanently destroyed to prevent unauthorized access or misuse. You Must document the destruction process in detail, including, but not limited to: the methods used, the date, and the personnel involved. You Must submit certification statements to the relevant University Official, affirming compliance with data protection laws and institutional policies. Acceptable methods of data destruction Must include shredding physical documents and using certified software or hardware for permanent deletion of digital records. Violations of this article constitute Academic Misconduct and will be adjudicated by the Office of Research Integrity, potentially resulting in sanctions as outlined in the Statement of Academic Sanctions.

content.title: Animal welfare 3R compliance
content.content: You must adhere to the highest standards of experimental ethics by ensuring animal welfare through strict compliance with the 3R principles: Replacement, Reduction, and Refinement. You must prioritize alternatives to animal use, such as computer models or cell cultures, wherever feasible (Replacement). You must minimize the number of animals used without compromising the study's integrity by using statistical tools to determine the smallest sample size needed (Reduction). You must ensure the highest standards of care to reduce distress or harm, including, but not limited to: providing adequate nutrition, veterinary care, and enrichment (Refinement).
